channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: 2026-27 Learning Assistant Applications Open!
item.description: Apply today to become a Learning Assistant for the 2026-27 Academic Year! Our Learning Assistants (LAs) support RPI’s orientation experiences and host interactive first-year and sophomore workshops and programs throughout the year to help students thrive academically, socially, and personally. Applications are due on February 26th!
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer Dining Survey Time
item.description: Help shape the future of Rensselaer Dining by taking our annual survey and win a private chef experience for you and 5 friends! All students that take the survey are eligible for this giveaway. Last day to take the survey is Friday, February 13th 2026. For more information and how to take the survey click the link above.
item.author: Students

item.title: STEM-Designated MS in Econ Info Session on 2/11
item.description: Discover how our STEM-Designated MS in Economics can help you advance your career. Join us for a virtual information session on 2/11 at 10:30am featuring: * An overview of the program structure and areas of focus * Insights into funding opportunities * Guidance on the application process
item.author: Community

item.title: Cognitive Science Colloquium with Alessa Farinella scheduled for February 11th
item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department on Wednesday, February 11th at 11am in Carnegie 113, for a presentation titled “Grouping in the production and perception of language” by Alessa Farinella, Ph.D. Candidate in the Department of Linguistics at UMass Amherst.
item.author: Community

item.title: The Future of Computing Research Collaboration (FCRC) 2026 Annual Workshop
item.description: This full-day workshop brings together RPI and IBM leadership, faculty, researchers, and students to highlight strategic priorities, research progress across the four FCRC tracks (AI Algorithms, AI HW/SW Codesign, Semiconductor Technology, and Quantum Computing), and future collaboration opportunities. Visit https://fcrc.rpi.edu/news for the agenda and registration link.
item.author: Community

item.title: Webinar Friday February 13: Webex Event Training
item.description: Hosting a campus event or supporting a student webinar? Join a hands-on Webex Event Training Webinar, part of the MMS Collaboration Software Training series. Register now for this webinar presented via Webex on Friday February 13 from 11am-12pm: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700 Learn the basics of Webex Event hosting, with demonstration and Q&A, along with new features recently added to the hosting platform.
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Seminar: Dr. Emily Davidson
item.description: Date: Thursday, February 12, 2026 12:30 PM - 1:30 PM - Hierarchical Materials through 3D Printing and Molecular Design Emily Davidson Princeton University
item.author: Community

item.title: Study Abroad Application Portal Open!
item.description: Are you an undergraduate student who is ready to study abroad? The application portal for summer/fall ’26 & AY ’26-’27 is open! Application deadlines are March 1 for affiliated exchanges and April 1 for non-affiliated study abroad. Visit the Education Abroad website for more information and application instructions: https://isss.rpi.edu/education-abroad/program-information/application-process-and-deadlines. Have questions? Contact Karen Dvorak, Education Abroad Program Manager, dvorak2@rpi.edu.
item.author: Community

item.title: STEM-Designated MS in Econ Info Session on 2/18
item.description: Discover how our STEM-Designated MS in Economics can help you advance your career. Join us for a virtual information session on 2/18 at 3pm featuring: * An overview of the program structure and areas of focus * Insights into funding opportunities * Guidance on the application process
item.author: Community

item.title: Upcoming closures in Shuttle services
item.description:
Friendly reminder that shuttles do not operate on holidays or during University closures. In observance of Presidents Day (February 16) and Spring Break (February 28–March 7), shuttles will not be running. Please plan accordingly.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Community
